description:
The Hardware Sales Operations team is responsible for the business planning and sales forecasting process throughout a hardware product’s lifecycle, from conception to end-of-life. We work with a variety of stakeholders from sales to supply chain to marketing, to launch new products with our third-party partners as well as with the Google Store. Our Hardware Partnerships team is responsible for managing all partnerships with carriers, retailers and OEMs worldwide.

As a Hardware Sales Lead, you'll work with a variety of stakeholders from Sales to Supply Chain to Marketing, to launch new products and technologies with our third-party partners and the Google store. You will implement a product availability plan and provide ongoing management to that plan via allocation/ongoing planning. Additionally, you will be the point of contact for the development, communication, and execution of product demand and supply plans.

Google’s Global Partnerships team powers extraordinary user experiences through meaningful partnerships. We build relationships that solve users’ needs, advance our partners’ goals, and further Google’s mission. Our team provides solutions for a range of partners — from helping publishers and developers grow their businesses through monetization solutions, to helping our long-term partners anticipate and navigate change in a way that delivers economic and reputational value. We build and distribute Google products through partnerships across a multitude of product areas, including Search, Assistant, Geo, News, Travel, and more. We collaborate across Google, ensuring a coordinated approach when engaging with our most complex and strategic partners.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in business or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of relevant work experience including product demand/supply planning, and production and inventory management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA degree.
  • Strategic planning, sales support and market research experience.
  • Knowledge of the consumer electronics market
  • Knowledge of supply chain practices.
responsibilities:
• Read and interpret market data to collaborate with Product Planning across new and existing markets/products.
  • Provide demand forecasts and work with stakeholders to help manage inventory, supply and orders across indirect and direct channels.
  • Assess risks and contingencies per product and work with regional counterparts to mitigate risks and analyze partner ordering bookings, billings, and performance against plan, then drive solutions with cross-functional stakeholders.
  • Coordinate across sales and operations functions to produce weekly updates for the Demand/Supply Planning Management team, driving towards product targets and performance goals.
  • Improve and implement allocation/planning/fulfillment processes to improve Google’s end-to-end supply chain and collaborate with Sales to plan and execute channel marketing activities with partners to drive sales performance.
title: Hardware Sales Lead, Hardware Partnerships
